observations.content:
[GAME] Welcome to Secret Mafia! You are Player 3.
Your role: Mafia
Team: Mafia
Description: A Mafia member. Eliminate villagers and gain majority.

Players: Player 0, Player 1, Player 2, Player 3, Player 4, Player 5

Your teammates are: Player 1, Player 3.

During DAY phase: Speak freely and vote.
During NIGHT phase: '[Player X]' to vote and eliminate a villager.
Win by eliminating villagers until Mafia equal or outnumber them.

[GAME] Night has fallen. Mafia, agree on a victim.
Valid targets: [0], [2], [4], [5]
[Player 1] Received – Mafia chat: deciding whom to eliminate.

My analysis:
- Player 4 resisted voting for Player 2 at the end of Day 1. This makes them look town-aligned.
- Player 5 pushed a mis-lynch onto Player 2 with very little resistance and didn’t try to protect anyone, which reads neutral-scummish.
- Player 0 has been the quietest overall and never drew any heat—classic low-threat villager profile.
- Player 2 is our partner and already flipped.

Conclusion: Player 4 is the cleanest town read remaining and the biggest long-term threat to us. Remove them now and it keeps suspicion on others tomorrow.

Vote: [4]
